peril.model.states

Class Test_Attack

  • java.lang.Object
    • peril.model.states.Test_Attack

  • public final class Test_Attack
extends java.lang.Object
    This tests the Attack functions properly.
    Since:
    2018-03-12
    Version:
    1.01.01
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    Attack, GameController

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Test_Attack.TestGC
      A version of the GameController that is tailored to only provide the functionality used for Test_Attack.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setUp()
      Sets up the elements that will be used by every test to test Attack.
      void test_select_blockadedLink()
      This method asserts that two otherwise valid ModelCountrys cannot be selected if they is a blockade between them.
      void test_select_enemy()
      This method asserts that a valid enemy ModelCountry cannot be selected before the valid friendly ModelCountry.
      void test_select_normal()
      This method asserts that two valid ModelCountry can be selected by the Attack.
      void test_select_notNeighbours()
      This method asserts that two otherwise valid ModelCountrys cannot be selected if they are not neighbours of each other.
      void test_select_swapPrimary()
      This method asserts that if two ModelCountrys ruled by the same ModelPlayer can be selected but when the second is selected it will replace the primary.

    • Field Detail

      • testAttack

        private Attack testAttack
        The Attack that is the subject of these tests.

      • testCurrentPlayer

        private ModelPlayer testCurrentPlayer
        The ModelPlayer that is currently active in the game. This is the ModelPlayer that will be returned from Test_Attack.TestGC.getCurrentModelPlayer().

      • testEnemyPlayer

        private ModelPlayer testEnemyPlayer
        Another ModelPlayer that serves as the enemy to the testCurrentPlayer.

      • Test_Attack

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets up the elements that will be used by every test to test Attack.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If setup fails throw Exception.

      • test_select_normal

        public void test_select_normal()
        This method asserts that two valid ModelCountry can be selected by the Attack. The primary country should be owned by the current player and the second should be the target for the attack. The target should be neutral or an enemy and be a neighbour with an open ModelLinkState from the primary. There must be a primary in order for the target to be selected.

      • test_select_swapPrimary

        public void test_select_swapPrimary()
        This method asserts that if two ModelCountrys ruled by the same ModelPlayer can be selected but when the second is selected it will replace the primary.

      • test_select_enemy

        public void test_select_enemy()
        This method asserts that a valid enemy ModelCountry cannot be selected before the valid friendly ModelCountry.

      • test_select_notNeighbours

        public void test_select_notNeighbours()
        This method asserts that two otherwise valid ModelCountrys cannot be selected if they are not neighbours of each other.

      • test_select_blockadedLink

        public void test_select_blockadedLink()
        This method asserts that two otherwise valid ModelCountrys cannot be selected if they is a blockade between them.
